title: 109_s1314
content: The Act titled "Clean Water Infrastructure Financing Act of 2005" amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to provide general authority for capitalization grants to accomplish the Act's purposes. The Clean Water Infrastructure Financing Act of 2005 amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to update requirements for construction of treatment works and provide guidance for small systems. The Clean Water Infrastructure Financing Act of 2005 updates requirements for construction of treatment works and provides guidance for small systems serving a population of 20,000 or fewer inhabitants. The Administrator shall publish a manual to assist small systems in obtaining assistance under this title and provide notice of its availability in the Federal Register. SEC. 4. WATER POLLUTION CONTROL REVOLVING FUNDS. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act amends Section 603 to specify activities eligible for assistance from the water pollution control revolving fund, including construction of treatment works, lake protection programs, and nonpoint source management programs. The water pollution control revolving fund can be used for various activities such as estuary conservation, riparian area protection, improving water use efficiency, preventing water pollution, and acquiring land for mitigation requirements related to treatment works construction. A State's revolving fund is established, maintained, and credited with repayments, with the balance available perpetually for financial assistance. Fees collected can only be used for administering the fund. Financially distressed communities may have an extended repayment period of up to 40 years or the expected life of the project. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to extend the repayment period for financially distressed communities to the lesser of 40 years or the project's expected life. Loan guarantees are provided for revolving funds and innovative technologies. Administrative expenses are also addressed in the amendments. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to extend repayment period for financially distressed communities. Loan guarantees are provided for revolving funds and innovative technologies. Technical and planning assistance for small systems is also included in the amendments. The Federal Water Pollution Control Act is amended to improve wastewater treatment plant operations and construction assistance. The amendments also include extending repayment periods for financially distressed communities and providing loan guarantees for revolving funds and innovative technologies. Technical and planning assistance for small systems is also emphasized. The act specifies eligibility criteria for treatment works to be considered publicly owned and allows for principal subsidization in cases where a State makes a loan to a financially distressed community. The State may provide additional subsidization to financially distressed communities, with a limitation of 30 percent of the capitalization grant received. The Administrator may publish information to assist States in establishing affordability criteria, and priority may be given to financially distressed communities in loan allocation. Financially distressed community is defined as meeting affordability criteria established by the State. The State must establish and develop community affordability criteria after public review and comment. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends Section 607 of the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to allocate $4,000,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2006 to 2010.
